content: hello again my friends! So nice to see there's healthy activity and a good number of open PRs. I'm coming up on some free cycles in life again, and I'll read through the zulip backlog and issues, but is there anything in particular anyone would like me to put some time into?

Another thing I wanted to comment, I transcribed Niko's 2019 PLISS talk on responsive compilers, which is mostly a presentation on Salsa. I'm going to see what I can contribute from that to the Salsa book, but I was wondering what you think of moving the salsa chapter from RDG to over there, seeing as it's not used in rustc.

If you're interested in Salsa, stay tuned! The compiler team is considering changes to incremental compilation that could include new work being done in Salsa. See #t-compiler/wg-incr-comp and https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/238009-t-compiler.2Fmeetings/topic/.5Bsteering.20meeting.5D.202022-04-01.20compiler-team.23490
(That's got nothing really to do with rustc-dev-guide, just thought I'd share the info)
